page.title: 17A DAY AT THE MAZE RACECOURSE
page.content: {A day at the Maze races.}The day begins very early for the trainers stable boys and stewards .They have to prepare the horses for the races. For the 'punter'the day starts about an hour before the race. Admission for adults is three pounds fifty pence.Programmes for the races are on sale and cost one pound. There is a new paddock where you can watch the horses being led around by their stable boys before each race. 'Bookies from all over come to give 'odds' on each race.They put up the names of the horses and the 'price'.As well as these 'bookies' there is also the 'tote'.It is a system of betting in which the total amount staked is divided among the winners in proportion to the size of their stake.
